page.title: 02THE LUNT FORT, BAGINTON
page.content: This Roman, peace-keeping and cavalry training installation dating back to the 1st century A.D.was discovered in 1960 by Brian Stanley. It is unique in the Roman world having the only Gyrus, a cavalry training ring. Reconstruction work was begun in 1960 and still continues today, under the supervision of Coventry Museum with labour provided by the Royal Engineers and the Manpower Services Commission. To date, a substantial section of the rampart, together with the gateway, granary and gyrus have been built, mainly fron oak timbers, and plans are already waiting for future work on the Principia. The fort is open regularly to the publis and provides and informative and enjoyable insight into the life of the Roman soldier with lifesize models of Legionaries and Auxiliaries.
